name: Scything Blade Snare
title: Scything Blade Snare
contents: text | This snare sends a powerful series of scything blades to slice through a creature entering the snare's square, dealing 14d8 slashing damage (DC 31 basic Reflex).

name: Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser)
title: Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
text | The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 10 minutes.

name: Sea Touch Elixir (Moderate)
title: Sea Touch Elixir (Moderate)
contents: text | This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
text | The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 1 hour, and you can breathe underwater.

name: Sea Touch Elixir (Greater)
title: Sea Touch Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
text | The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 24 hours, and you can breathe underwater.

name: Serene Mutagen (Lesser)
title: Serene Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves to +2 when you attempt Will saves against mental effects. The duration is 1 minute.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

name: Serene Mutagen (Moderate)
title: Serene Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves to +3 when you attempt Will saves against mental effects. The duration is 10 minutes.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

name: Serene Mutagen (Greater)
title: Serene Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves to +4 when you attempt Will saves against mental effects. When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

name: Serene Mutagen (Major)
title: Serene Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks.  When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead, and your critical failures on Will saves against mental effects become failures instead. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

name: Serum of Sex Shift
title: Serum of Sex Shift
contents: text | Upon drinking this potion, your biology instantly transforms to take on a set of sexual characteristics of your choice, changing your appearance and physiology accordingly. You have mild control over the details of this change, but you retain a strong "family resemblance" to your former appearance.

text | The magic functions instantaneously and can't be counteracted. Your new anatomy is as healthy and functional as your previous body's, potentially allowing you to procreate (depending on your ancestry's biology). Drinking a subsequent serum of sex shift allows you to either revert back to your original form or adopt other sexual characteristics, as you choose. The elixir has no effect if you are pregnant or from an ancestry with no sexual differentiation. Most ancestries have a wide spectrum of sexual differentiation, some common, others more rare.

name: Shadow
title: Shadow Rune
contents: text | Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

name: Shadow (Greater)
title: Shadow (Greater) Rune
contents: text | Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

name: Shadow (Major)
title: Shadow (Major) Rune
contents: text | Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

name: Shadow Essence
title: Shadow Essence
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | injury | negative | poison
text | Distilled from the Plane of Shadow, this oily substance imposes tenebrous effects. The enfeebled condition from shadow essence lasts for 24 hours.
section | Affliction DC 29 Fortitude; **Onset** immediate; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds
bullet | Stage 1 | 3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison damage (1 round)
bullet | Stage 2 | 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 3 | 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

name: Shark Tooth Charm
title: Shark Tooth Charm
contents: text | This dried seaweed bracelet is lined with charms shaped like small shark teeth. When you activate the bracelet, if you roll a success on the triggering check, you get a critical success instead (if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead). If you fail the Acrobatics check against a grabbing creature, the creature must either release you as a free action or take 2d8 piercing damage as shark's teeth momentarily emerge from your skin.

name: Shifting
title: Shifting Rune
contents: text | With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form.

text | The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon's runes and any precious material it's made of apply to the weapon's new shape. Any property runes that can't apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.

name: Shining Ammunition
title: Shining Ammunition
contents: text | A piece of shining ammunition gives off a faint glow. When shot, this ammunition sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes. If it hits a target, it sticks, causing the target to shed light in the same radius. A creature can remove the ammunition with an Interact action, but the ammunition itself continues to glow for the rest of the duration or until destroyed.

name: Shock
title: Shock Rune
contents: text | Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

name: Shock (Greater)
title: Shock (Greater) Rune
contents: text | Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.
text | Electricity damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's electricity resistance (and the other creatures' on a critical hit).

name: Shrinking Potion (Standard)
title: Shrinking Potion (Standard)
contents: text | This fungus-flavored potion conveys the effects of the shrink spell to make you and all your gear smaller. After the onset, you remain small for 10 minutes.

name: Signal Whistle
title: Signal Whistle
contents: text | When sounded, a signal whistle can be heard clearly up to half a mile away across open terrain.

name: Signaling Snare
title: Signaling Snare
contents: text | A subtle snare used in hunting or tracking, a signaling snare often consists of carefully prepared earth, piled sand or stones, specific arrangements of vegetation, and so forth.

text | When a creature enters a square of a signaling snare, nothing happens to the creature, but instead it causes a small, unobtrusive disruption to the terrain that allows the snare's creator or another creature who knows what to look for to determine whether a creature of the appropriate size entered the square.

name: Silver (Chunk)
title: Silver (Chunk)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

name: Silver (Ingot)
title: Silver (Ingot)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

name: Silver (Low-Grade  Object)
title: Silver (Low-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

name: Silver (Standard-Grade  Object)
title: Silver (Standard-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

name: Silver (High-Grade  Object)
title: Silver (High-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

name: Silver Armor (Low-Grade)
title: Silver Armor (Low-Grade)
contents: text | Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

name: Silver Armor (Standard-Grade)
title: Silver Armor (Standard-Grade)
contents: text | Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

name: Silver Armor (High-Grade)
title: Silver Armor (High-Grade)
contents: text | Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

name: Low-Grade Silver Buckler
title: Low-Grade Silver Buckler
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

name: Silver Shield (Low-Grade)
title: Silver Shield (Low-Grade)
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

name: Standard-Grade Silver Buckler
title: Standard-Grade Silver Buckler
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

name: Silver Shield (Standard-Grade)
title: Silver Shield (Standard-Grade)
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

name: High-Grade Silver Buckler
title: High-Grade Silver Buckler
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

name: Silver Shield (High-Grade)
title: Silver Shield (High-Grade)
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

name: Silver Weapon (Low-Grade)
title: Silver Weapon (Low-Grade)
contents: text | Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

name: Silver Weapon (Standard-Grade)
title: Silver Weapon (Standard-Grade)
contents: text | Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

name: Silver Weapon (High-Grade)
title: Silver Weapon (High-Grade)
contents: text | Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

name: Silversheen
title: Silversheen
contents: text | You can slather this silvery paste onto one melee weapon, one thrown weapon, or 10 pieces of ammunition. Silversheen spoils quickly, so once you open a vial, you must use it all at once, rather than saving it. For the next hour, the weapon or ammunition counts as silver instead of its normal precious material (such as cold iron) for any physical damage it deals.

name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Lesser)
title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 1 minute.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Moderate)
title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 10 minutes.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Greater)
title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 1 hour.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Major)
title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 1 hour.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

name: Skeleton Key (Standard)
title: Skeleton Key (Standard)
contents: text | A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves' tools when attempting to Pick a Lock, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.
text | If the skeleton key becomes broken due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves' tools and loses its benefits until repaired.
section | undefined [[free-action]] Interact| *Trigger* You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven't rolled yet
text | The key casts knock on the lock you're trying to pick.

name: Skeleton Key (Greater)
title: Skeleton Key (Greater)
contents: text | A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves' tools when attempting to Pick a Lock, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.
text | If the skeleton key becomes broken due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves' tools and loses its benefits until repaired.
section | undefined [[free-action]] Interact| *Trigger* You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven't rolled yet
text | The key casts knock on the lock you're trying to pick.
text | The key grants a +2 item bonus, and you can activate the key once per hour.

name: Sky Hammer
title: Sky Hammer
contents: text | The sturdy, steel head of this +3 major striking flaming shock orichalcum warhammer is shaped like a blazing comet.
section | undefined [[reaction]] command| *Trigger* Your attack roll with the sky hammer is a critical success
text | A 6th-level arcane fireball spell explodes, centered on the sky hammer. The spell DC is 45. You are immune to the fireball's effect, though your allies are not.

name: Sleep Arrow
title: Sleep Arrow
contents: pftrait | consumable | enchantment | magical | mental | sleep

text | Sleep arrows often have shafts of deep blue or black, and their fletching is exceptionally soft and downy. An activated sleep arrow deals no damage, but a living creature hit by it is subject to the effects of a sleep spell (DC 17).

name: Slick
title: Slick Rune
contents: text | This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

name: Slick (Greater)
title: Slick (Greater) Rune
contents: text | This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

name: Slick (Major)
title: Slick (Major) Rune
contents: text | This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

name: Sling Bullets
title: Sling Bullets
contents: text | These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
title: Slippers of Spider Climbing
contents: text | These soft slippers are made of fine gray silk. If the slippers are left unattended for a while, they tend to attract spiders that nest inside.

text | Tiny, hairlike tendrils extend from the slippers' soles, allowing you to walk on vertical surfaces or even to move upside down along ceilings. For 1 minute, you gain a 20-foot climb Speed and you don't need to use your hands to Climb. However, the slippers require decent traction for you to walk on a wall, so they provide no benefit when you're moving across greased, icy, or oiled surfaces.

name: Slumber Wine
title: Slumber Wine
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | ingested | poison | sleep
text | Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury.

text | Characters unconscious from slumber wine can't wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don't need to eat or drink while unconscious in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a DC 40 Medicine check.
section | Affliction DC 32 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 hour; **Max Dur.** 7 days

name: Smokestick (Lesser)
title: Smokestick (Lesser)
contents: text | With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a 5-foot burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

name: Smokestick (Greater)
title: Smokestick (Greater)
contents: text | With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a 20-foot burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

name: Snake Oil
title: Snake Oil
contents: text | You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn't feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a DC 17 Perception check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil's effects.

name: Snare Kit
title: Snare Kit
contents: text | This kit contains tools and materials for creating snares. A snare kit allows you to Craft snares using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn snare kit as part of the action to use it.

name: Snare Kit (Specialist)
title: Snare Kit (Specialist)
contents: text | This kit contains tools and materials for creating snares. A snare kit allows you to Craft snares using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn snare kit as part of the action to use it.
text | A specialist snare kit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check.

name: Sneaky Key
title: Sneaky Key
contents: text | This small silver skeleton key can be pinned to armor or a sleeve. When you turn the key to activate it, for the next minute, if the outcome of any your attempts to Pick a Lock is a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

name: Speed
title: Speed Rune
contents: text | Attacks with a speed weapon are supernaturally swift. While wielding a speed weapon, you gain the quickened condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the etched weapon.

name: Spell-storing
title: Spell-storing Rune
contents: text | A spell-storing rune creates a reservoir of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower into the weapon. The spell must have a casting of 2 actions or fewer and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect—it is instead stored for later. When you wield a spell-storing weapon, you immediately know the name and level of the stored spell. A spell-storing weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM's choice stored in it.
text | You unleash the stored spell, which uses the target of the triggering attack as the target of the spell. This empties the spell from the weapon and allows a spell to be cast into it again.
text | If the spell requires a spell attack roll, the result of your attack roll with the weapon determines the degree of success of the spell, and if the spell requires a saving throw, the DC is 30.
text | Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.

name: Spellbook (Blank)
title: Spellbook (Blank)
contents: text | A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

name: Spellguard Shield
title: Spellguard Shield
contents: text | This shield bears eldritch glyphs to guard against magic. While you have this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) raised, you gain its circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells that target you (as well as to AC).

name: Spellstrike Ammunition (Type I)
title: Spellstrike Ammunition (Type I)
contents: text | Mystic patterns create a magic reservoir within this ammunition. You activate spellstrike ammunition by Casting a Spell into the ammunition. The spell must be of a spell level the ammunition can hold (1st-level or lower), and the spell must be able to target a creature other than the caster. A creature hit by activated spellstrike ammunition is targeted by the spell. If the creature isn't a valid target for the spell, the spell is lost.

text | The ammunition affects only the target hit, even if the spell would normally affect more than one target. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, use the result of your ranged attack roll with the ammunition to determine the degree of success of the spell. If the spell requires a saving throw, the target attempts the save against your spell DC.

name: Spider Root
title: Spider Root
contents: text | A paste made by mashing the fine, threadlike roots of a certain creeper vine, spider root renders a victim clumsy and maladroit.
section | Affliction DC 28 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 minute; **Max Dur.** 6 minutes
bullet | Stage 1 | 8d6 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 minute)
bullet | Stage 2 | 9d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 minute)
bullet | Stage 3 | 10d6 poison damage and clumsy 3 (1 minute)

name: Spike Snare
title: Spike Snare
contents: text | This basic snare consists of hidden spikes that rely on a creature's momentum to lacerate or potentially impale it as it enters the snare's square, dealing 2d8 piercing damage. The creature must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex saving throw.

name: Spined Shield
title: Spined Shield
contents: text | Five jagged spines project from the surface of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The spines are +1 striking shield spikes. When you use the Shield Block reaction with this shield, the spines take the damage before the shield itself does. When the shield would take damage (after applying Hardness), one spine snaps off per 6 damage, reducing the damage by 6. The shield takes any remaining damage. When there are no spines left, the shield takes damage as normal.
text | When all the spines are gone, you lose the ability to attack with them until the spines regenerate the next day.
text | You shoot one of the shield's spines at a target. A fired spine uses the spikes' statistics, but it is a martial ranged weapon with a range increment of 120 feet.

name: Spyglass
title: Spyglass
contents: text | A typical spyglass lets you see eight times farther than normal.

name: Spyglass (Fine)
title: Spyglass (Fine)
contents: text | A typical spyglass lets you see eight times farther than normal.
text | A fine spyglass adds a +1 item bonus to Perception checks to notice details at a distance.

name: Staff of Abjuration
title: Staff of Abjuration
contents: text | This intricately carved wooden staff is warm to the touch and thrums with inner energy. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify abjuration magic.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **2nd** dispel magic, endure elements, resist energy

text | The item bonus granted to heal spells is +1.

text | The gem at the top of the staff glows as a torch, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

name: Staff of Illusion
title: Staff of Illusion
contents: text | This ornately designed metal staff shines with precious inlays of gold. When you Cast a Spell from the staff, the illusory image of something you desire flashes across its surface.
text | While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify illusion magic.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

name: Staff of Power
title: Staff of Power
contents: text | This staff of magically hardened wood is topped with a silver sculpture depicting magical runic symbols. When used as a weapon, a staff of power is a +2 greater striking staff.

text | Voluntarily destroying a staff of power unleashes an incredible blast of energy. When wielding the staff, you can Interact to break it. This releases a 30-foot-burst magical explosion centered on the staff. This deals 2d8 force damage per charge remaining in the staff (DC 40 basic Reflex save)
text | You automatically critically fail your save. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly; this is a death effect.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **7th** cone of cold, fireball, lightning bolt

name: Staff of the Magi
title: Staff of the Magi
contents: text | Sigils and runes of ancient and powerful magic cover the iron cladding on this long wooden staff. A staff of the magi is a +3 major striking staff, and when wielding it you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells.

text | Voluntarily destroying a staff of the magi unleashes a truly devastating wave of arcane energy that surges out, dissipating with distance. When wielding the staff, you can break it using an Interact action. This releases a 30-foot-burst magical explosion centered on the staff. This deals 2d10 force damage per charge remaining in the staff (DC 40 basic Reflex save), You automatically critically fail your save. The explosion continues to echo beyond the initial blast zone, dealing half as much damage to creatures beyond 30 feet but within a 60-foot burst. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly; this is a death effect.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **Cantrip** detect magic, light, mage hand, telekinetic projectile
bullet | **2nd** enlarge, glitterdust, invisibility, knock, telekinetic maneuver, web
bullet | **3rd** dispel magic, fireball, lightning bolt
bullet | **4th** invisibility, enlarge, fireball, wall of fire, web
bullet | **5th** cone of cold, passwall, telekinetic haul
bullet | **6th** disintegrate, dispel magic, fireball, lightning bolt
bullet | **7th** cone of cold, passwall, plane shift, wall of fire
bullet | **9th** dispel magic, meteor swarm, summon dragon

name: Stalker Bane Snare
title: Stalker Bane Snare
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | mechanical | snare | trap

text | This snare explodes in a burst of cloying powder that can cling to a creature stepping into its square. A creature that enters the square of a stalker bane snare must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.
property | Critical Success | The target is unaffected.

property | Success | Powder sticks to the target, causing it to leave behind telltale footprints. Being invisible makes the target hidden, rather than undetected, to creatures that could see it if it weren't invisible.

property | Failure | Powder clumps on the target, constantly flaking away. Being invisible makes the target concealed, rather than hidden or undetected, to creatures that could see it if it weren't invisible.
property | Critical Failure | As failure, and the creature is blinded until the end of its next turn.

name: Stone Bullet
title: Stone Bullet
contents: text | This sling bullet looks like a petrified serpent's eye. A creature hit by an activated stone bullet is subject to the effects of a 6th-level flesh to stone spell (DC 34).

name: Stone Fist Elixir
title: Stone Fist Elixir
contents: text | Your fists become hard as stone. For 1 hour, your fists deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage and lose the nonlethal trait.

name: Storm Arrow
title: Storm Arrow
contents: pftrait | air | consumable | electricity | evocation | magical
text | The head of this arrow is made from gleaming copper.

text | When an activated storm arrow hits a target, it is buffeted by raging winds and struck by a bolt of lightning that deals 3d12 electricity damage and the target must attempt a DC 25 Reflex saving throw. If this arrow is shot from a weapon with a shock property rune, the save DC increases to 27, though the attack doesn't benefit from the shock property rune itself.
property | Critical Success | The foe is unaffected.
property | Success | The foe takes half damage and isn't affected by the wind.
property | Failure | The foe takes full damage and is buffeted by winds for 1 round, taking a –2 circumstance penalty to ranged attack rolls and a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its fly Speed.
property | Critical Failure | As failure, but the foe takes double damage.

name: Storm Flash
title: Storm Flash
contents: text | This +2 greater striking shock rapier has a golden blade, and miniature electric arcs flash across its guard while it's wielded. When out of its sheath under an open sky, the blade causes storm clouds to gather slowly above.
text | You cast a 6th-level lightning bolt (DC 33).
section | undefined [[reaction]] command| *Trigger* An electricity effect targets you or a creature within 10 feet of you, or has you or a creature within 10 feet of you in its area

text | You try to divert the electricity off course, to be absorbed by storm flash. Choose one eligible creature to protect and roll a melee attack roll against the DC of the electricity effect. If you succeed, the chosen creature takes no electricity damage from the triggering effect.

name: Storm Flash (Greater)
title: Storm Flash (Greater)
contents: text | This +2 greater striking shock rapier has a golden blade, and miniature electric arcs flash across its guard while it's wielded. When out of its sheath under an open sky, the blade causes storm clouds to gather slowly above.
text | You cast a 6th-level lightning bolt (DC 33).
section | undefined [[reaction]] command| *Trigger* An electricity effect targets you or a creature within 10 feet of you, or has you or a creature within 10 feet of you in its area

text | You try to divert the electricity off course, to be absorbed by storm flash. Choose one eligible creature to protect and roll a melee attack roll against the DC of the electricity effect. If you succeed, the chosen creature takes no electricity damage from the triggering effect.
text | This is a +3 greater striking greater shock rapier. When activating the sword to cast lightning bolt, the spell is 8th level (DC 38).

name: Striking
title: Striking Rune
contents: text | A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

text | You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

name: Striking (Greater)
title: Striking (Greater) Rune
contents: text | A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

text | You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
text | The weapon deals three weapon damage dice.

name: Striking (Major)
title: Striking (Major) Rune
contents: text | A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

text | You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
text | The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.

name: Striking Snare
title: Striking Snare
contents: text | You affix a trip line or other trigger to a group of either stones or wooden stakes to strike a creature that enters the snare's square. The creature must attempt a DC 26 basic Reflex saving throw. If you choose stones, the snare deals 9d8 bludgeoning damage; if you choose spikes, it deals 9d8 piercing damage.

name: Stunning Snare
title: Stunning Snare
contents: text | You rig a snare to disorient a creature with a quick bash, leaving it with little ability to defend itself. The trap deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage to the first creature to enter its square; that creature must attempt a DC 31 Reflex save.
property | Critical Success | The creature is unaffected.
property | Success | The creature takes half damage and is flat-footed for 1 round and stunned 1.
property | Failure | The creature takes full damage and is flat-footed for 1 round and stunned 2.
property | Critical Failure | The creature takes double damage and is flat-footed for 1 minute and stunned 4.

name: Sturdy Shield (Minor)
title: Sturdy Shield (Minor)
contents: text | With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
text | The shield has Hardness 8, HP 64, and BT 32.

name: Sturdy Shield (Lesser)
title: Sturdy Shield (Lesser)
contents: text | With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
text | The shield has Hardness 10, HP 80, and BT 40.

name: Sturdy Shield (Moderate)
title: Sturdy Shield (Moderate)
contents: text | With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
text | The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.

name: Sturdy Shield (Greater)
title: Sturdy Shield (Greater)
contents: text | With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
text | The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.

name: Sturdy Shield (Major)
title: Sturdy Shield (Major)
contents: text | With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
text | The shield has Hardness 17, HP 136, and BT 68.

name: Sturdy Shield (Supreme)
title: Sturdy Shield (Supreme)
contents: text | With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
text | The shield has Hardness 20, HP 160, and BT 80.

name: Sunrod
title: Sunrod
contents: text | This 1-foot-long, gold-tipped rod glows after it's struck on a hard surface. For the next 6 hours, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

name: Survey Map
title: Survey Map
contents: text | Maps are uncommon. Most maps you can find are simple and functional. A survey map details a single location in excellent detail. One of these maps gives you a +1 item bonus to Survival checks and any skill checks to Recall Knowledge, provided the checks are related to the location detailed on the map. The GM determines what maps are available in any location.

name: Survey Map (Atlas)
title: Survey Map (Atlas)
contents: text | Maps are uncommon. Most maps you can find are simple and functional. A survey map details a single location in excellent detail. One of these maps gives you a +1 item bonus to Survival checks and any skill checks to Recall Knowledge, provided the checks are related to the location detailed on the map. The GM determines what maps are available in any location.
text | Maps sometimes come in atlases, containing a number of maps of the same quality, often on similar topics. An atlas costs five times as much as a single map and requires both hands to use.

name: Swift Block Cabochon
title: Swift Block Cabochon
contents: pftrait | uncommon | abjuration | consumable | magical | talisman

text | This clear quartz cabochon attaches to the center of your shield. When you activate the cabochon, you use the Shield Block reaction even if you hadn't raised the affixed shield (and even if you don't normally have that reaction).

name: Tack
title: Tack
contents: text | Tack includes all the gear required to outfit a riding animal, including a saddle, bit and bridle, and stirrups if necessary. Especially large or oddly shaped animals might require specialty saddles. These can be more expensive or hard to find, as determined by the GM. The Bulk value given is for tack worn by a creature. If carried, the Bulk increases to 2.

name: Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)
title: Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)
contents: text | A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances.
text | When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a –10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.

text | On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

text | The target can end any effects by Escaping (Escape DC 17) or spending a total of 3 Interact actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

name: Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate)
title: Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate)
contents: text | A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances.
text | When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a –15-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.
text | You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

text | On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

text | The target can end any effects by Escaping (Escape DC 19) or spending a total of 3 Interact actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

name: Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)
title: Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)
contents: text | A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances.
text | When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a –15-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.
text | You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

text | On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

text | The target can end any effects by Escaping (Escape DC 28) or spending a total of 3 Interact actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

name: Tanglefoot Bag (Major)
title: Tanglefoot Bag (Major)
contents: text | A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances.
text | When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a –20-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.
text | You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

text | On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

text | The target can end any effects by Escaping (Escape DC 37) or spending a total of 3 Interact actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

name: Tears of Death
title: Tears of Death
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | contact | poison | virulent
text | Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.
section | Affliction DC 46 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 minute; **Max Dur.** 10 minutes
bullet | Stage 1 | 18d6 poison damage and paralyzed (1 round)
bullet | Stage 2 | 25d6 poison damage and paralyzed (1 minute)
bullet | Stage 3 | 30d6 poison damage and paralyzed (1 minute)

name: Ten-Foot Pole
title: Ten-Foot Pole
contents: text | When wielding this long pole, you can use Seek to search a square up to 10 feet away. The pole is not sturdy enough to use as a weapon.

name: Thieves' Tools
title: Thieves' Tools
contents: text | You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with replacement picks appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

name: Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator)
title: Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator)
contents: text | You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with replacement picks appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.
text | Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

name: Thieves' Tools (Concealable)
title: Thieves' Tools (Concealable)
contents: text | You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with replacement picks appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

text | Smaller and made of stronger materials than most sets of thieves' tools, the items in this kit are much easier to conceal. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks to Conceal these tools. They otherwise function as infiltrator thieves' tools.

name: Third Eye
title: Third Eye
contents: text | When invested, this ornate crown and its incandescent gemstone meld into your head and take the form of a tattoo.

text | This grants you otherworldly sight and allows you to read auras. No one but you can manipulate the third eye while it's invested by you. Your heightened senses and ability to sense emotional auras grant you a +3 item bonus to Perception checks.

text | You continuously see magic auras, as a 9thlevel detect magic spell, except you see the location of all auras within 30 feet, not just the strongest. If you use a Seek action to study a creature you can see, you can perceive an aura that conveys knowledge of that creature's health, including all conditions and afflictions it has and an approximate percentage of its remaining Hit Points.
text | You gain the effects of an 8th-level true seeing spell.

name: Thundering
title: Thundering Rune
contents: text | This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

name: Thundering (Greater)
title: Thundering (Greater) Rune
contents: text | This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).
text | The save DC is 34, and the deafness is permanent. Sonic damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's sonic resistance.

name: Thunderstone (Lesser)
title: Thunderstone (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | sonic | splash

text | When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals 1d4 sonic damage and 1 sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn.

name: Thunderstone (Moderate)
title: Thunderstone (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | sonic | splash

text | When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals 2d4 sonic damage and 2 sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

name: Thunderstone (Greater)
title: Thunderstone (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | sonic | splash

text | When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals 3d4 sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

name: Thunderstone (Major)
title: Thunderstone (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | sonic | splash

text | When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals 4d4 sonic damage and 4 sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

name: Thurible of Revelation (Lesser)
title: Thurible of Revelation (Lesser)
contents: text | This brass censer dangles on a length of chain.
text | Most thuribles of revelation are adorned with swirling Celestial text, though some are iron and feature Infernal or Abyssal text.

text | You light the incense inside the censer, and it burns for 1 hour. During that time, as long you are holding the thurible, you gain a +1 item bonus to Religion checks, and any critical failure you roll when you Decipher Writing of a religious nature is a failure instead.

name: Thurible of Revelation (Moderate)
title: Thurible of Revelation (Moderate)
contents: text | This brass censer dangles on a length of chain.
text | Most thuribles of revelation are adorned with swirling Celestial text, though some are iron and feature Infernal or Abyssal text.

text | You light the incense inside the censer, and it burns for 1 hour. During that time, as long you are holding the thurible, you gain a +1 item bonus to Religion checks, and any critical failure you roll when you Decipher Writing of a religious nature is a failure instead.

text | The thurible grants a +2 bonus. Once per day, when you activate the thurible, you can increase its revelations. During that activation, you can hold the thurible up to your eyes with an Interact action to gain the effects of see invisibility for 1 round by peering through the smoke.

name: Thurible of Revelation (Greater)
title: Thurible of Revelation (Greater)
contents: text | This brass censer dangles on a length of chain.
text | Most thuribles of revelation are adorned with swirling Celestial text, though some are iron and feature Infernal or Abyssal text.

text | You light the incense inside the censer, and it burns for 1 hour. During that time, as long you are holding the thurible, you gain a +1 item bonus to Religion checks, and any critical failure you roll when you Decipher Writing of a religious nature is a failure instead.

text | The thurible grants a +3 bonus. The greater version shares the once-per-day enhanced revelations of the moderate version, except peering through the smoke also grants you the effects of true seeing.

name: Tiger Menuki
title: Tiger Menuki
contents: text | This tiger formed of pewter snarls viciously from your weapon's grip. When you activate the tiger, the affixed weapon gains the sweep trait for the triggering attack and all other attacks for 1 minute.

name: Tindertwig
title: Tindertwig
contents: text | An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

name: Tool (Long)
title: Tool (Long)
contents: text | This entry is a catchall for basic hand tools that don't have a specific adventuring purpose. A hoe, shovel, or sledgehammer is a long tool, and a hand drill, ice hook, or trowel is a short tool. A tool can usually be used as an improvised weapon, dealing 1d4 damage for a short tool or 1d6 for a long tool. The GM determines the damage type that's appropriate or adjusts the damage if needed.

name: Tool (Short)
title: Tool (Short)
contents: text | This entry is a catchall for basic hand tools that don't have a specific adventuring purpose. A hoe, shovel, or sledgehammer is a long tool, and a hand drill, ice hook, or trowel is a short tool. A tool can usually be used as an improvised weapon, dealing 1d4 damage for a short tool or 1d6 for a long tool. The GM determines the damage type that's appropriate or adjusts the damage if needed.

name: Torch
title: Torch
contents: text | A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 1 hour. It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

name: Tracker's Goggles
title: Tracker's Goggles
contents: text | These lenses of forest-green glass are bound in rough leather stitched with crude twine. While wearing these goggles, you gain a +1 bonus to Survival checks to Sense Direction and Track. If you fail a check to Track, you can try again after 30 minutes rather than an hour.

name: Tracker's Goggles (Greater)
title: Tracker's Goggles (Greater)
contents: text | These lenses of forest-green glass are bound in rough leather stitched with crude twine. While wearing these goggles, you gain a +1 bonus to Survival checks to Sense Direction and Track. If you fail a check to Track, you can try again after 30 minutes rather than an hour.
text | The goggles grant a +2 bonus. If you fail a check to Track, you can try again after 15 minutes rather than an hour.

name: Traveler's Any-tool
title: Traveler's Any-tool
contents: text | Before it's activated, this item appears to be an ash rod capped with steel on either end.
text | You imagine a specific simple tool, and the any-tool transforms into it.

text | (Usually, you can choose from a tool listed in Chapter 6). This transforms the wooden portion into any haft and the metal caps into spades, hammer heads, or the like, allowing for most basic tools but nothing more complex. You can return the item to its rod form with an Interact action.

name: Trip Snare
title: Trip Snare
contents: text | You set a cunning wire to trip a creature. A Medium or smaller creature that enters this snare's square must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.

text | If you want to create a trip snare to trip a larger creature, you must create a group of contiguous snares of a length equal to the edge of that larger creature's space, and the creature must be moving such that it moves into the full set of snares.
text | For example, three trip snares in a 15-foot-line can trip a Huge creature coming down a corridor into the line of snares.
property | Critical Success | The creature is unaffected.
property | Success | The creature is flat-footed until the start of its next turn.
property | Failure | The creature falls prone.
property | Critical Failure | The creature falls prone and takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

name: Triton's Conch
title: Triton's Conch
contents: text | If you put this large opalescent conch shell to your ear, you can hear the sound of the roaring sea crashing against the shore.

text | You can raise the conch to your lips and blow into it, letting out a long, rumbling note. For the next minute, you and all allies who were within 30 feet of you when you activated the conch gain a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to Swim and can breathe under water.

name: Truesight Potion
title: Truesight Potion
contents: text | Upon drinking this clear, refreshing potion, you can see things as they actually are. You gain the benefits of a 7th-level true seeing spell that has a counteract modifier of +25.

name: Truth Potion
title: Truth Potion
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | enchantment | magical | mental | potion
text | For 10 minutes after drinking this astringent potion, you can't intentionally lie and may be compelled to tell the truth.
text | Upon drinking the potion, attempt a DC 19 Will save. You can voluntarily fail or critically fail.
property | Success | The potion does not affect you.
property | Failure | When you speak, you must tell the truth.

property | Critical Failure | As failure, and when someone asks you a question, you must attempt another DC 19 Will saving throw. If you fail this saving throw, you must answer the question truthfully if you are able to do so; if you succeed, you are temporarily immune to further attempts to ask the same question within the potion's duration.

name: Twining Staff
title: Twining Staff
contents: text | Appearing to be just a small, flat disc made of twigs, this item can grow and shrink.

text | You cause the twigs to rapidly grow or contract, reshaping into a +1 striking staff, a +1 striking bo staff, or its disc form. In its disc form, it has negligible Bulk and must be held in one hand to be activated. In the other forms, it has the same Bulk as a normal weapon of its type. You can switch your grip as part of the activation.

text | When you expand the item, you can use the force of the expansion to High Jump or to try to Force Open a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the Athletics check with a +15 modifier.

name: Unholy
title: Unholy Rune
contents: text | An unholy rune instills fiendish power into the etched weapon.
text | A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 evil damage when it hits a good target. If you are good, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.
section | undefined [[reaction]] command| *Trigger* You critically succeed at an attack roll against a good creature with the weapon
text | The target takes persistent bleed damage equal to 1d8 per weapon damage die of the etched weapon.

name: Unholy Water
title: Unholy Water
contents: text | An evil deity's malice lies within this vial of water. You activate a vial of unholy water by throwing it as a Strike. It's a simple thrown weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn't add the manipulate trait to the attack made with it.
text | Unholy water deals 1d6 evil damage and 1 evil splash damage.
text | It damages only celestials and creatures that have a weakness to evil damage.

name: Vanishing Coin
title: Vanishing Coin
contents: text | This copper coin dangles from a leather strip strung through a hole drilled in the center. Until activated, the coin becomes invisible for a few seconds at random intervals every few minutes. When you activate the coin, it casts a 2nd-level invisibility spell on you, lasting until the end of your next turn.

name: Ventriloquist's Ring
title: Ventriloquist's Ring
contents: text | This elegant copper ring has miniature images of songbirds engraved around its circumference. You gain a +1 item bonus to Deception checks.
text | Twisting the ring around your finger allows you to magically throw your voice, with the effects of a ventriloquism spell (DC 19).

name: Ventriloquist's Ring (Greater)
title: Ventriloquist's Ring (Greater)
contents: text | This elegant copper ring has miniature images of songbirds engraved around its circumference. You gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks.
text | Twisting the ring around your finger allows you to magically throw your voice, with the effects of a 2nd-level ventriloquism (DC 27).

name: Verdant Staff
title: Verdant Staff
contents: text | This oak branch grows leaves in spring that change color in autumn and shed in winter. While wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify plants.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **1st** shillelagh (can target the verdant staff)
bullet | **2nd** barkskin, entangle, shape wood, tree shape

name: Verdant Staff (Greater)
title: Verdant Staff (Greater)
contents: text | This oak branch grows leaves in spring that change color in autumn and shed in winter. While wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify plants.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **5th** plant form, wall of thorns

name: Vine Arrow
title: Vine Arrow
contents: text | Leafy stalks protrude from the shaft of this rustic arrow. When an activated vine arrow hits a target, the arrow's shaft splits and grows, wrapping the target in vines. The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 2d4 rounds, or until it Escapes against a DC of 19. On a critical hit, the target is also immobilized until it Escapes.

name: Viper Arrow
title: Viper Arrow
contents: text | The shaft of this arrow is covered in fine green scales, and its iron head comes to a pair of points almost like fangs. After an activated viper arrow hits a target, the arrow transforms into a viper. The target is affected by the viper's poison, as if it had been bitten. The viper then lands in an open space adjacent to the target.

text | The viper has the summoned trait and acts at the end of your turn, even though you didn't use the Sustain a Spell action. It is under the GM's control, but it generally attacks the creature the arrow struck. The viper vanishes after 1 minute or when slain.

name: Viper's Fang
title: Viper's Fang
contents: text | You are a master with the affixed weapon.
text | When you activate this resin-strengthened viper skull, you make an Attack of Opportunity against the triggering creature.
text | If you have Attack of Opportunity, you can activate the viper's fang as a free action.

name: Vorpal
title: Vorpal Rune
contents: text | Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock, vorpal weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head.
section | undefined [[reaction]] envision death, incapacitation| *Trigger* You roll a natural 20 on a Strike with the weapon, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage.

text | The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don't require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.

name: Voyager's Pack
title: Voyager's Pack
contents: text | This leather rucksack has icons burned into it, and every time it's taken to a plane it hasn't been to before, a new icon representing that plane scorches into the surface. The pack grants you a +3 bonus to Survival checks.

text | It also enables you to see the magical traces of creatures' passage, allowing you to Track a creature that has teleported. The GM sets the DC of this check, usually using the level and DC of the teleportation spell. This lets you find the location of the creature's destination, and you can use that destination when casting teleport or activating the pack, even though you don't know what it looks like.

text | The pack contains an extradimensional space with the same properties as a type II bag of holding. This space contains the contents of a climber's kit. If any components of that kit are removed and not returned, they return to the pack at dawn each day.
section | undefined 10 minutes command, envision, Interact

text | As you activate the pack, you can harness up to four willing creatures to the ropes on the pack. At the end of the activation time, the pack casts a 7th-level plane shift or teleport spell, transporting you and everyone attached to the pack. Attempt a DC 45 Survival check. On a success, you arrive 25 miles off target using plane shift or halve the distance you're off-target with teleport. On a critical success, you arrive exactly on target.

name: Wand of Continuation (1st-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (1st-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (2nd-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (2nd-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (3rd-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (3rd-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (4th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (4th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (5th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (5th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (6th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (6th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (7th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (7th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Continuation (8th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Continuation (8th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.
text | You Cast the Spell, and its duration is increased by half.

name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (1st-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Manifold Missiles (1st-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

text | You cast magic missile of the indicated level. After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (3rd-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Manifold Missiles (3rd-Level Spell)
contents: text | This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

text | You cast magic missile of the indicated level. After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

name: Wand of Slaying (7th Level Spell)
title: Wand of Slaying (7th Level Spell)
contents: text | This polished black wand has a green gem at the tip, and anyone who looks into it sees a reflection of a grinning skull instead of their face.

text | You cast finger of death of the indicated level. If the spell slays its target, the corpse releases negative energy in a 20-foot emanation, dealing negative damage equal to double the spell's level.

name: Wand of Slaying (8th Level Spell)
title: Wand of Slaying (8th Level Spell)
contents: text | This polished black wand has a green gem at the tip, and anyone who looks into it sees a reflection of a grinning skull instead of their face.

text | You cast finger of death of the indicated level. If the spell slays its target, the corpse releases negative energy in a 20-foot emanation, dealing negative damage equal to double the spell's level.

name: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (3rd-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (3rd-Level Spell)
contents: text | This blackened, heavily burned stick smells faintly of bat guano.
text | You cast fireball of the indicated level. Each creature that fails its save takes 1d6 1d6 persistent fire damage.

name: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (5th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (5th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This blackened, heavily burned stick smells faintly of bat guano.
text | You cast fireball of the indicated level. Each creature that fails its save takes 2d6 2d6 persistent fire damage.

name: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (7th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (7th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This blackened, heavily burned stick smells faintly of bat guano.
text | You cast fireball of the indicated level. Each creature that fails its save takes 3d6 3d6 persistent fire damage.

name: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (9th-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs (9th-Level Spell)
contents: text | This blackened, heavily burned stick smells faintly of bat guano.
text | You cast fireball of the indicated level. Each creature that fails its save takes 4d6 4d6 persistent fire damage.

name: Wand of Widening (1st-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Widening (1st-Level Spell)
contents: text | The end of this wand is forked instead of tapered.

text | You Cast the Spell, and increase its area. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet; add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller; or add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

name: Wand of Widening (2nd-Level Spell)
title: Wand of Widening (2nd-Level Spell)
contents: text | The end of this wand is forked instead of tapered.

text | You Cast the Spell, and increase its area. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet; add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller; or add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

name: Warning Snare
title: Warning Snare
contents: pftrait | auditory | consumable | mechanical | snare | trap
text | Using materials specific to the area, you connect a sound-making component to a trip wire or a pressure plate.

text | This snare is like an alarm snare, but its subtle sound blends into ambient noise. You can detect this sound as long as you're within 1,000 feet of the snare and aren't prevented from hearing it. Other creatures in that area who are searching might notice the sound if their Perception check result meets or exceeds your Craft DC.

name: Waterskin
title: Waterskin
contents: text | When it's full, a waterskin contains roughly 1 day's worth of water for a Small or Medium creature.

name: Wayfinder
title: Wayfinder
contents: text | This compact compass repurposes ancient technology to draw fantastic powers from the mysterious magical items called aeon stones. It serves as a badge of office for agents of the Pathfinder Society and as a status symbol among adventurers of any stripe. A wayfinder functions as a compass.

text | An indentation in the middle of the wayfinder can hold a single aeon stone. Placing an aeon stone in this indentation provides you all the benefits of having the aeon stone orbiting your head, but it protects the stone from being noticed or stolen as easily. You invest a wayfinder and the aeon stone within it simultaneously, and they count as only one item toward your investiture limit. An invested aeon stone slotted in a wayfinder also grants its resonant power.

text | If you have more than one wayfinder with an invested aeon stone on your person at a given time, destructive interference from their resonance prevents you from gaining benefits from any of them. You can still benefit from additional aeon stones orbiting your head, just not in wayfinders.
text | The wayfinder is targeted by a 1st-level light spell.

name: Weapon Potency (+1)
title: Weapon Potency (+1) Rune
contents: text | Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.

text | You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

name: Weapon Potency (+2)
title: Weapon Potency (+2) Rune
contents: text | Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +2 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes.

text | You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

name: Weapon Potency (+3)
title: Weapon Potency (+3) Rune
contents: text | Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +3 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes.

name: Weapon Potency (+4)
title: Weapon Potency (+4) Rune
contents: text | The item bonus to attack rolls is +4, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes.

text | This version of the potency rune has been added by PF2eTools. This rune is not available for purchase or Crafting through mundane means. It only exists on Unique and/or Artifact weaponry, such as Axe Of The Dwarven Lords or Serithtial.

name: Whisper of the First Lie
title: Whisper of the First Lie
contents: text | This delicate necklace contains bottled whispers distilled from a source on the Astral Plane rumored to be connected to the first lie ever told.

text | While wearing the necklace, you gain a +3 item bonus to Deception checks, and you can attempt to counteract effects that would force you to tell the truth or determine whether you are lying. Success on this counteract attempt lets you ignore the effect, rather than removing the effect entirely. The counteract level is 9, with a counteract modifier of +35.
text | You unstopper the vial and release the lie, creating the effect of a fabricated truth (DC 47). The vial is emptied and can never be activated again.

name: Winged Boots
title: Winged Boots
contents: text | Made from soft leather, with delicate white wings attached to the heel, these boots are ensorcelled with powerful air magic. Whenever you fall while wearing these boots, the boots automatically cast feather fall on you. This benefit can't trigger again for 10 minutes.
text | You speak a command word and click the boots' heels together to cause the wings to animate and flap rapidly, granting you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes.

name: Winter Wolf Elixir (Lesser)
title: Winter Wolf Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold.

name: Winter Wolf Elixir (Moderate)
title: Winter Wolf Elixir (Moderate)
contents: text | This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold.
text | You're also protected from extreme cold.

name: Winter Wolf Elixir (Greater)
title: Winter Wolf Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold.
text | You're also protected from extreme and incredible cold.

name: Wolf Fang
title: Wolf Fang
contents: text | This wolf canine is bound in a strip of leather and tied to a buckle or strap of a suit of armor. When you activate the fang, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier to the target of your Trip. If your Trip would already deal physical damage that doesn't include an ability modifier, add your Strength modifier to that damage.

name: Wolfsbane
title: Wolfsbane
contents: text | Wolfsbane appears in folklore for its link to werecreatures.
text | If you are afflicted with lycanthropy and survive stage 3 of wolfsbane, you're immediately cured of the lycanthropy.
section | Affliction DC 30 Fortitude; **Onset** 10 minutes; **Max Dur.** 6 minutes

name: Wondrous Figurine (Golden Lions)
title: Wondrous Figurine (Golden Lions)
contents: text | Each one of these statuettes is 1 inch in height, carved from a specific material and taking the shape of a particular animal or animals.

text | You activate the statue by placing it on solid ground and then speaking its name, causing the statuette to transform into a living creature or creatures.
